site_name: Streetcube Kiosk 1 On Pavement Outside Tk Maxx
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The permission is for a limited time period and all of the structures and associated works hereby approved shall be removed before 1 February 2025 with the site returned to its former condition to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority
Reason: The building is of a temporary nature and in order to monitor the impact of the proposal

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed 4D02BP REV C (with dimensions) received 19/01/2022
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 3 - The use hereby permitted shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of:
07:00 - 21:00 Monday to Sunday 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Condition : 4 - The open footway and carriageway on the A3 (Wandsworth High Street) shall not be obstructed by the structures and associated equipment hereby approved and no 'A' boards/power cables or any associated equipment shall be present on the open section of the footway. 
Reason: To ensure that adequate space is provided for pedestrians and to ensure that the plan is sensitive to the amenity of local residents in accordance with Council policies DMT1 and DMT2 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Condition : 5 - Deliveries, loading and servicing of the units shall be undertaken from the Southside side of the site.  All vehicles associated with the gazebos must only park/stop at permitted locations and within the time periods permitted by existing on-street restrictions
Reason: To ensure that adequate arrangements are made for deliveries and
servicing to the site and to ensure that the plan is sensitive to the amenity of
local residents in accordance with Council policies DMT1 and DMT2 of the
Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Condition : 6 - Prior to commencement of use, a Management Plan for the operation of the structures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Management Plan shall provide details of the daily operation of the structures including details of the removal of all the structures and associated equipment at the end of each day or any subsequent arrangement agreed in conjunction with Transport for London. The Management Plan shall also set out the waste and recycling arrangements and details of delivery and servicing taking into account the requirements of condition 5. The Management Plan shall be adhered to at all times throughout the duration of the permission. 
Reason: To ensure that adequate arrangements are provided and to ensure that the plan is sensitive to the amenity of local residents in accordance with Council policies DMS1, DMT1 and DMT2 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE: The applicant is advised that the existing structures on the forecourt do not have planning permission and an application would need to be submitted for determination in accordance with the relevant policies and guidance.
description: Temporary permission (3 years) for the use of pavement section for erection of up to 8 de-mountable wooden structures for the purpose of cooking and selling fresh foods (street food market).
